alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 9:41AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHERN DEARBORN, NORTHERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 AM EDT... At 941 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Harrison, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Fairfield, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Harrison, Wyoming, Mount Healthy, Bright, West Chester, Ross, Taylor Creek, Dry Ridge, Blue Jay, Dunlap and Pleasant Hills. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 16 and 17. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 158 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 4. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 14 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
